newsitem.title: SINGAPORE: Singapore shares close firmer, upside seen capped.
newsitem.headline: Singapore shares close firmer, upside seen capped.

text.p: The Singapore stock market ended up on technicals on Friday with small-capitalised stocks dominating the actives, dealers said. They added the upside was capped by lacklustre economic fundamentals.
After opening at 2,061.51, the key Straits Times Industrials Index ended at 2,077.20, up 17.59 points.
The bulk of the gains in the index was generated by Cerebos Pacific, Fraser & Neave and Keppel which rose S$0.50, S$0.30 and S$0.10 respectively, albeit in light volumes.
Turnover was light at around 108 million shares, with gainers leading losers at 173 to 143.

Dealers said there was some nibbling of selected blue-chips by institutions. The UOB blue-chip index rose 6.92 points to end at 895.86. Retailers stayed keen on small-capitalised stocks like Venture, Labroy Marine and Uraco Holdings, all of which topped the actives. Venture saw 7.8 million shares traded, including 7.4 million crossed in the morning at S$2.55.

Foreign counters of SIA Ltd and Singapore Press rose S$0.70 each to S$14.00 and S$24.90. Bukit Sembawang Estate fell S$0.50 to S$33.00. Dealers said Malaysia's budget announcements made little impact. The UOB OTC index which tracks Malaysian shares here ended 2.40 points off at 1,201.97.--Angela Tan (65 8703083)
